description: Borrowed from French chignon circa 1780, when the hairstyle was in fashion.

entries.meaning: A roll or twist of hair worn at the nape of the neck; a bun.
examples: The physician should evaluate for a history of tight ponytails, buns, chignons, braids, twists, weaves, cornrows, dreadlocks, sisterlocks, and hair wefts in addition to the usage of religious hair coverings.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A temporary swelling on a neonate's head after a ventouse-assisted delivery.
